abstract: Indiana Gov Mike Pence rejects criticism of state's Religious Freedom Restoration Act, which he signed into law, saying he expects General Assembly to introduce legislation that will clarify law's intent; measure has spurred protests and threats to halt business with state over what critics say is law that condones discrimination against gays and lesbians.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Mike Pence said he would seek legislation to clear up misunderstandings about the state’s Religious Freedom Restoration Act, denying that it gives license to discriminate against gays and lesbians.

headline.main: Indiana Governor Says Legislators May Clarify Religious Beliefs Law
headline.print_headline: Legislators in Indiana May Clarify Beliefs Law

snippet: Gov. Mike Pence said he would seek legislation to clear up misunderstandings about the state’s Religious Freedom Restoration Act, denying that it gives license to discriminate against gays and lesbians.
